intro: Amsinckia mathewsii, commonly known as the Mathews' fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces yellow flowers in the spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Amsinckia mathewsii is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
